alert.note: Alert for Brown; Calumet; Kewaunee; Manitowoc; Outagamie; Portage; Waupaca; Waushara; Winnebago; Wood (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 10 at 2:12PM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...SNOW EXPECTED TO RESULT IN HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS THIS EVENING... A quick-moving low pressure system will pass just north of Wisconsin this evening, bringing a narrow band of moderate to occasionally heavy snow. The heaviest snow is expected to occur between 5 pm and 8 pm across central Wisconsin and between 8 pm and midnight across east-central Wisconsin, including the Fox Valley and lakeshore. Snowfall totals in the 1 and 3 inch range can be expected; however, the combination of intense snowfall rates and some blowing snow, will lead to hazardous traveling conditions this evening. The precipitation will taper off to light snow showers across much of the area overnight; however, portions of east-central and far northeast Wisconsin may see a mix to freezing drizzle or just plain drizzle as temperatures increase above freezing overnight. Anyone planning travel during the evening hours should expect to encounter hazardous road conditions, and allow extra time to reach their destination.
